intro: Psilochenia pleurocarpa, commonly known as the pleurocarp fern, is a member of the family Pterobryaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, lanceolate leaves. Its fronds are usually unifacial, with a single layer of photosynthetic cells. Psilochenia pleurocarpa is characterized by its simple, non-branching sporophylls and is often found in temperate regions.
